討.definition: to invite; to provoke; to demand or ask for; to send armed forces to suppress; to denounce or condemn; to marry (a woman); to discuss or study

討乞.definition: to go begging; to ask for alms

討人.definition: (old) girl trafficked into a brothel to work as prostitute

討人喜歡.definition: to attract people's affection; charming; delightful

討伐.definition: to suppress by armed force; to send a punitive expedition against; to crusade against

討便宜.definition: to look for a bargain; to seek advantage; to try to gain at expense of others

討價還價.definition: to haggle over price; to bargain

討厭.definition: to dislike; to loathe; disagreeable; troublesome; annoying

討好.definition: to get the desired outcome; to win favor by fawning on sb; to curry favor with; a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor

討好賣乖.definition: to curry favor by showing obeisance (idiom)

討嫌.definition: disagreeable; hateful; a pain in the neck

討巧.definition: to act cleverly to get what one desires; to get the best at least expense

討平.definition: to put down (an uprising); to pacify

討底兒.definition: erhua variant of 討底|讨底[tao3 di3]

討擾.definition: I beg to disturb you; I trespass on your hospitality; Thank you for your hospitality!

討教.definition: to consult; to ask for advice

討海.definition: to make one's living from the sea

討生活.definition: to eke out a living; to live from hand to mouth; to drift aimlessly

討賬.definition: to demand payment; to collect overdue payment

討還.definition: to ask for sth back; to recover

討飯.definition: to ask for food; to beg

討饒.definition: to beg for mercy; to ask for forgiveness
